chapters.description: Arjuna's dilemma on the battlefield of Kurukshetra

verses.sanskrit: धृतराष्ट्र उवाच | धर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे समवेता युयुत्सवः | मामकाः पाण्डवाश्चैव किमकुर्वत सञ्जय ||
verses.transliteration: dhṛtarāṣṭra uvāca | dharmakṣetre kurukṣetre samavetā yuyutsavaḥ | māmakāḥ pāṇḍavāścaiva kimakurvata sañjaya ||
verses.translation: Dhritarashtra said: O Sanjaya, assembled on the holy field of Kurukshetra, eager to fight, what did my sons and the sons of Pandu do?

verses.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच | दृष्ट्वा तु पाण्डवानीकं व्यूढं दुर्योधनस्तदा | आचार्यमुपसङ्गम्य राजा वचनमब्रवीत् ||
verses.transliteration: sañjaya uvāca | dṛṣṭvā tu pāṇḍavānīkaṃ vyūḍhaṃ duryodhanastadā | ācāryamupasaṅgamya rājā vacanamabravīt ||
verses.translation: Sanjaya said: Having seen the army of the Pandavas arrayed in battle formation, King Duryodhana approached his teacher and spoke these words.

chapters.description: Krishna teaches Arjuna about the eternal soul and the path of knowledge

verses.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच | तं तथा कृपयाविष्टमश्रुपूर्णाकुलेक्षणम् | विषीदन्तमिदं वाक्यमुवाच मधुसूदनः ||
verses.transliteration: sañjaya uvāca | taṃ tathā kṛpayāviṣṭamaśrupūrṇākulekṣaṇam | viṣīdantamidaṃ vākyamuvāca madhusūdanaḥ ||
verses.translation: Sanjaya said: To him who was thus overcome with pity, whose eyes were filled with tears and bewildered, Madhusudana (Krishna) spoke these words.

verses.sanskrit: कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन | मा कर्मफलहेतुर्भूर्मा ते सङ्गोऽस्त्वकर्मणि ||
verses.transliteration: karmaṇyevādhikāraste mā phaleṣu kadācana | mā karmaphalaheturbhūrmā te saṅgo'stvakarmaṇi ||
verses.translation: You have the right to work only, but never to its fruits. Let not the fruits of action be your motive, nor let your attachment be to inaction.

chapters.description: Krishna explains the importance of selfless action

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | ज्यायसी चेत्कर्मणस्ते मता बुद्धिर्जनार्दन | तत्किं कर्मणि घोरे मां नियोजयसि केशव ||
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca | jyāyasī cetkarmaṇaste matā buddhirjanārdana | tatkiṃ karmaṇi ghore māṃ niyojayasi keśava ||
verses.translation: Arjuna said: O Janardana, if You consider knowledge superior to action, why then do You urge me to engage in this terrible action, O Keshava?
